chunks.text:
Email Conversation Export
=========================
Export Date: 2025-09-26 11:42:44
Folder: C1F1OSQ - incidents - chalhoub
Message Count: 3

--------------------------------------------------
ID: C1F1OSQ_00
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Kechichian, Kevork <Kevork.Kechichian@marsh.com>
CC: Ozdinc, Yekta <Yekta.Ozdinc@marsh.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-03-28 11:17
Subject: Incidents - Chalhoub
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Kev,

 

Please see below incidents

 

Unauthorised Chalhoub discounts availed by using fake employee accounts – Loss  $300k No OTP and employee validation at checkout on websites.

 

Bot Attack against Level Shoes Website (November 2024)

On 19th November 2024, a bot attack took place targeting the Level Shoes website. The attacker targeted a section on the website during checkout where customers can enter their mobile numbers to receive an OTP, this OTP then creates or links their Loyalty program account. The attacker executed scripts in sending a significant number of SMS One Time Passwords being to foreign numbers resulting in an abnormal SMS bill. It’s important to note that whilst Level Shoes is part of Chalhoub Group, the technology is managed independently by Level Shoes team themselves.

Actions undertaken: Identified section which was attacked was protected with CAPTCHA and global rate limiting. This significantly reduced the ability for attacker to execute a script.  Further activities also took place, report available if required.

Loss $400k

Actions undertaken: Identified section which was attacked was protected with CAPTCHA and global rate limiting. This significantly reduced the ability for attacker to execute a script.  Further activities also took place, report available if required.

Loss $400k

 

Compromise of VP Account due to 3rd Party compromise (September 2024)

On 4th September, a Vice President working in People team was compromised after receiving a malicious link from a trusted and known third party. The incident resulted in a business email compromise. The incident was flagged, and credentials were changed including MFA re-registration. Additionally since this date, enhanced email security solution has been brought in (Mimecast) to detect such cases of malicious links.

 

API Security Incident (November 2023)

On Friday 24th November, a threat actor executed scripts targeted the main Chalhoub realm (eu01-chalhoub.demandware.net) using OCAPI (Open Commerce API) resulting in unauthorized changes at mass scale to stock levels for various brands. During the period of attack which was approximately 2 hours and 15 minutes, there were over 420,000 inventory data API calls to make inventory changes to the ‘Swarovski.ae’ domain. ​The OCAPI Client ID and password was used to perform this attack.

Actions undertaken: OCAPI credentials identified to have been used during this attack were changed and API traffic was moved to newer version of Mulesoft which enabled additional security controls. Further activities did take place and a report is available if required.

Actions undertaken: OCAPI credentials identified to have been used during this attack were changed and API traffic was moved to newer version of Mulesoft which enabled additional security controls. Further activities did take place and a report is available if required.

 

Cisco Unified Call Manager Attack (October 2022) –

During October 2022, unauthorised telephone calls were made by a Threat Actor calling premium international numbers from a store location in Riyadh. The activity of this took place outside of business hours. Logs identified that the Threat Actor managed to access the softphone via a store router that was connected to the Softphone and then made configuration change to amend the number extensions.

Actions undertaken: The router security was hardened including access controls lists reviewed. Extensions added by the threat actor was removed. Enhanced security controls were implemented on the SIEM including use case creation for out of hours activity and new extensions added.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 8045000

	
 	
 <https://chalhoubgroup.com/> 

CHALHOUBGROUP.COM <http://www.chalhoubgroup.com/> 


‑

Hi Hagop ,

 

In reference to our discussion , kindly note that after tremendous negotiations , We have convinced Beazley the leader to reconsider the pricing despite the new claims information as per below .

 

Other terms and conditions remain unchanged 

 

 

Limit: USD 10M

Retention: USD 250K

Waiting Period: 12 hours

RI Premium: USD 280K – exclusive of fronting fee (3.5-5 % ) and taxes.

 

Hope to hear from you soon .

 

Best Regards,

Kev
